transportAdvice: Belfast is a compact city where many central attractions are walkable, and a network of local buses covers tourist areas and outer neighbourhoods well. Taxis are widely available throughout the city, and black cabs offer a distinctive local experience.

weather.description: Cold and frequently wet with short daylight hours, typical of a Northern Irish winter.
Similar to January with persistent grey skies and occasional frost, though days slowly lengthen.
Early spring brings slightly milder temperatures but rain remains frequent and winds can be brisk.
Noticeably brighter with longer days and occasional sunny spells, though showers are still common.
One of the more pleasant months with mild temperatures and a good mix of sunshine and showers.
Warm and relatively bright with long evenings, though overcast days and rain are still expected.
The warmest month of the year with the best chance of sustained dry spells and long daylight hours.
Warm and often pleasant but rain can return, making it a mixed but generally enjoyable summer month.
Early autumn brings cooler evenings and increasing rainfall while daytime temperatures remain comfortable.
Noticeably wetter and windier as autumn sets in, with shorter days and frequent overcast skies.
Cold and damp with limited daylight, typical of late autumn in Northern Ireland.
Cold and often wet with the shortest days of the year, though festive city centre atmosphere adds appeal.
